verses.text: 耶穌離開那裡，來到自己的家鄉，他的門徒跟著他。

words.note: Literally 'door follower' or 'school pupil'

verses.text: 到了安息日，他開始在會堂裡教導人；很多人聽見了，都驚奇地說：「這個人從哪裡得來這一切呢？所賜給他的是怎麼樣的智慧，竟然藉著他的手行出這樣的神蹟？

words.note: Day of rest and worship
Meeting hall for Jewish worship
Nominalizer indicating 'that which is...'
Literally 'divine trace' or 'spiritual sign'

verses.text: 這不是那木匠嗎？不是馬利亞的兒子，雅各、約西、猶大、西門的哥哥嗎？他的妹妹們不也在我們這裡嗎？」他們就厭棄耶穌。
耶穌對他們說：「先知除了在自己的本鄉、本族、本家之外，沒有不受人尊敬的。」

words.note: Literally 'one who knows first'

verses.text: 耶穌不能在那裡行甚麼神蹟，只給幾個病人按手，醫好了他們。

words.note: Literally 'divine trace' or 'spiritual sign'
A practice often associated with healing or blessing.

verses.text: 對於那些人的不信，他感到詫異。耶穌到周圍的鄉村去繼續教導人。

words.note: Refers to a state of lacking faith.

verses.text: 他把十二門徒叫來，差遣他們兩個兩個地出去，賜給他們勝過污靈的權柄；

words.note: Refers to followers or students of a religious leader.
Often used in religious contexts for divine sending.
Used idiomatically as 'two by two'.
Often used for gifts or blessings from a superior or deity.
A specific term for malevolent spirits in the Bible.
Emphasizes rightful power and governing influence.

verses.heading: Sending Out the Twelve Apostles

verses.text: 吩咐他們說：「除了手杖以外，路上甚麼都不要帶，不要帶乾糧，不要帶口袋，腰袋裡也不要帶錢，

words.definition: on the road, on the way

words.note: Refers to food for a journey, often dried for preservation.
A small bag or pouch worn at the waist, typically for money.

verses.text: 只穿一雙鞋，不要穿兩件衣服。」
又對他們說：「你們無論到哪裡，進了一家就住在那家，直到離開那個地方。
甚麼地方不接待你們，不聽你們，你們離開那地方的時候，就要把腳上的灰塵跺下去，作為反對他們的見證。」

words.note: Lit. 'stomp down and away', indicating an action of removal.

verses.text: 門徒就出去傳道，叫人悔改，

words.note: Lit. 'gate/school follower'.
Lit. 'spread the Way/Tao'.
Lit. 'regret and change'.

verses.text: 趕出許多鬼，用油抹了許多病人，醫好他們。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to demons or evil spirits.
好 indicates the successful completion of the action.

verses.text: 當時耶穌的名聲傳揚出去，希律王也聽到了。有人說：「施洗的約翰從死人中復活了，所以他身上有行神蹟的能力。」

words.note: Used as a directional complement here.
到 indicates successful completion of the action.
Lit. 'return to life'.
Lit. 'divine trace' or 'spiritual wonder'.

verses.heading: The Death of John the Baptist

verses.text: 又有人說：「他是以利亞。」還有人說：「他是先知，像古時先知中的一位。」

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
位 is a polite measure word for people.

verses.text: 希律聽見就說：「是約翰，我砍了他的頭，他又活了！」
原來希律曾親自派人去捉拿約翰，把他捆鎖在監裡。他這樣作，是為了他弟弟的妻子希羅底的緣故，因為他娶了希羅底為妻，

words.definition: it turned out that, as a matter of fact

verses.text: 而約翰曾對希律說：「你佔有你兄弟的妻子是不合理的。」
於是希羅底懷恨在心，想要殺他，只是不能。
因為希律懼怕約翰，知道他是公義聖潔的人，就保護他。希律聽了約翰的話，就非常困擾，卻仍然喜歡聽他。

words.note: Often used in theological contexts for divine justice.
A common compound in biblical texts describing purity and holiness.

verses.text: 有一天，機會來了。在希律生日的那一天，他為大臣、千夫長和加利利的要人擺設了筵席。

words.note: Refers to high-ranking officials in government.
A military commander of a thousand men.
More formal than 宴會 (yànhuì).

verses.text: 希羅底的女兒進來跳舞，使希律和在座的賓客都很開心。王就對女孩子說：「你無論想要甚麼，只管向我求，我一定給你！」
並且對她再三起誓：「你無論向我求甚麼，就是我國的一半，我也一定給你！」

words.note: More formal or archaic than 發誓 (fāshì).

verses.text: 於是她出去問母親：「我該求甚麼呢？」希羅底告訴她：「施洗的約翰的頭！」

words.note: Often used to introduce a consequence or conclusion.
Literally 'John who baptizes'.

verses.text: 她急忙到王面前，向王要求說：「願王立刻把施洗的約翰的頭放在盤子上給我！」

words.note: Often used in formal or prayer-like expressions.
Literally 'John who baptizes'.

verses.text: 希律王非常憂愁，但是因為他的誓言和在座的賓客，就不願拒絕她。

words.note: Lit. 'not ordinary'

verses.text: 希律王立刻差遣一個侍衛，吩咐把約翰的頭拿來。侍衛就去了，在監裡斬了約翰的頭，
把頭放在盤子上，拿來交給那女孩子，女孩子又交給她的母親。
約翰的門徒聽見了，就來把他的屍體領去，安放在墳墓裡。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower', implying a student who entered the 'door' of teaching.
Resultative compound: 'listen and perceive'
Implies placing with care or in a final resting place.

verses.text: 使徒們回來聚集在耶穌跟前，把他們所作和所教導的一切都報告給他聽。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'
Forms a nominalized verb phrase like 'that which was V-ed'
Forms a nominalized verb phrase like 'that which was V-ed'

verses.heading: The Feeding of the Five Thousand

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「來，你們自己到曠野去休息一下。」因為來往的人多，他們甚至沒有時間吃飯。

words.note: Common term in the Bible for uninhabited regions.
Used after a verb to indicate brief action.

verses.text: 他們就悄悄地上了船，到曠野去了。

words.note: Common term in the Bible for uninhabited regions.

verses.text: 群眾看見他們走了，有許多人認出了他們，就從各城出來，跑到那裡，比他們先趕到。
耶穌一下船，看見一大群人，就憐憫他們，因為他們好像羊沒有牧人一樣，就開始教導他們許多事。

words.note: A formal term for compassion, often used in religious contexts.
Often used in religious contexts for spiritual leaders.

verses.text: 天晚了，門徒前來對他說：「這裡是曠野的地方，天已經很晚了，

words.note: Specifically refers to religious or philosophical disciples.
Common term in the Bible for uninhabited regions.

verses.text: 請叫他們散開，好讓他們往周圍的田舍村莊去，自己買點東西吃。」

words.note: Used before things to indicate 'a little bit of'.
Commonly refers to objects in general, can mean 'food' in context.

verses.text: 耶穌回答他們：「你們給他們吃吧！」門徒說：「要我們去買兩百銀幣的餅給他們吃嗎？」

words.note: Literally 'gate/school followers', meaning disciples of a master or school of thought.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「去看看你們有多少餅！」他們知道了，就說：「五個餅，還有兩條魚。」

words.note: Reduplicated verb indicating a brief or casual action.

breakdown.m: measure word for long, thin objects

verses.text: 耶穌吩咐他們叫大家分組坐在青草地上。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix indicating 'on top of'.

verses.text: 他們就一排一排地坐了下來，有一百的，有五十的。

words.note: Reduplicated structure indicating 'one by one' or 'in groups of'.
Indicates movement from higher to lower position, or a static 'settling down'.
Here, '的一百的' means 'those of a hundred (people)'.
Here, '的五十的' means 'those of fifty (people)'.

verses.text: 耶穌拿起這五個餅、兩條魚，望著天，祝謝了；然後把餅擘開，遞給門徒擺在群眾面前，又把兩條魚也分給群眾。

words.note: Refers to giving thanks or blessing a meal.
Specifically refers to breaking bread by hand, common in biblical context.

verses.text: 大家都吃了，並且吃飽了。
他們把剩下的零碎撿起來，裝滿了十二個籃子，
吃餅的人，男人就有五千。

words.note: A verb-object phrase used adjectivally to describe '人'.

verses.text: 事後耶穌立刻催門徒上船，叫他們先渡到對岸的伯賽大去，等他自己叫眾人散開。
verses.heading: Walking on Water

verses.text: 他離開了他們，就上山去禱告。

words.note: Verb-object compound: 'to report a prayer'

verses.text: 到了晚上，船在海中，耶穌獨自在岸上，
看見門徒辛辛苦苦地搖櫓，因為風不順。天快亮的時候（「天快亮的時候」原文作「夜裡四更天」），耶穌在海面上向他們走去，想要趕過他們。

words.note: Resultative verb compound: 'look' + 'perceive'
Lit. 'gate student'
Reduplication for emphasis, indicating arduous effort.

words.definition: to want to, be going to

verses.text: 門徒看見他在海面上走，以為是鬼怪，就喊叫起來；

words.note: Lit. 'gate student'
Resultative verb compound: 'look' + 'perceive'
Indicates the beginning of an action or an upward movement.

verses.text: 因為他們都看見了他，非常恐懼。耶穌立刻對他們說：「放心吧！是我，不要怕。」

words.note: Resultative verb compound: 'look' + 'perceive'
Lit. 'not usual', meaning extraordinary.
Lit. 'release heart'

words.definition: to want, to need (in negation, 'must not')

verses.text: 於是上了船，和他們在一起，風就平靜了。門徒心裡十分驚奇，
因為他們還不明白分餅這件事的意義，他們的心還是遲鈍。

words.note: Refers to the miracle of feeding the multitudes.
Often refers to spiritual dullness in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 他們渡過了海，就在革尼撒勒靠岸，
verses.heading: Healing the Sick

verses.text: 一下船，眾人立刻認出耶穌來，
就跑遍那一帶地方，把有病的人放在褥子上，聽見他在哪裡，就抬到哪裡。
耶穌無論到甚麼地方，或村莊，或城市，或鄉野，眾人都把病人放在街上，求耶穌准他們摸他衣服的繸子，摸著的人就都好了。

words.note: Used to place the object before the verb, often indicating how it's dealt with.
Refers to the ritual fringes (tzitzit) on Jewish garments in biblical context.
The resultative complement 著 (zháo) indicates successful contact.
Used to make a phrase into an attributive or nominalizer, meaning 'the one who...'
Here, 'good' means restored to health, healed.
